title: Salamanca
summary: Salamanca (/ˌsæləˈmæŋkə/ SAL-ə-MANK-ə, Spanish: [salaˈmaŋka]) is a city situated in western Spain and is the capital of the Province of Salamanca in the autonomous community of Castile and León. The city lies on several rolling hills by the Tormes River. Its Old City was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1988. As of 2018, the municipality has a population of 143,978.
